events.title: Research Denver Doctors
events.description: Research and identify doctors in Denver who will be good fits for both Josh and Candace's medical needs. Notify current providers about the move and get their recommendations.
actionItems: Find a primary care doctor for Josh
Find an HAE specialist for Candace
Find a primary care doctor for Candace
Find a gynecologist for Candace
Find a cardiologist for Candace
Find a neurologist for Candace
Notify Dr. Reidl about the move — ask for Denver provider recommendations
Notify Tiana about the move — ask for Denver provider recommendations
Schedule genetic testing for Candace's HAE in San Diego
Plan San Diego trip for HAE genetic testing
events.notes: The HAE genetic testing in San Diego should be done before the move while it's still a short trip. Dr. Reidl and Tiana may have professional networks or know colleagues in Denver — their referrals could be invaluable.
calypsySuggestions: Denver has National Jewish Health — one of the top respiratory/immunology centers in the country. They may have HAE specialists or connections to one
University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus is a major academic medical center — great for finding specialists across all of Candace's needs in one system
Check if current insurance plans have provider networks in Colorado, or if you'll need to switch plans during open enrollment
The US Hereditary Angioedema Association (HAEA) has a physician directory — use it to find HAE-experienced doctors in Denver
Ask Dr. Reidl and Tiana early (July) so you have time to act on their recommendations
San Diego trip for genetic testing could double as a goodbye visit — make it a nice weekend

events.title: Establish Medical Care
events.description: Begin establishing care with Denver providers. Start with telehealth appointments where possible to get the relationship going before arrival, and book in-person appointments for after the move.
actionItems: Contact selected providers and confirm they're accepting new patients
Schedule telehealth introductory appointments where available
Request medical records transfers from all current providers
Get copies of all prescriptions and ensure adequate supply for the transition
Book in-person new patient appointments for November/December
Verify insurance coverage for all selected providers
Set up patient portal accounts with new providers
events.notes: Starting with telemed gives a 3+ month head start on building relationships with new doctors. In-person appointments can be booked for the weeks after arrival in mid-November.
calypsySuggestions: Many specialists have 2-3 month wait times for new patients — booking in August for November appointments is actually right on time
Request a complete copy of Candace's medical records early — some offices take 2-4 weeks to process records requests
For HAE specifically, make sure the new specialist has Candace's full treatment history and current medication protocol before the first visit
Check if Colorado requires new prescriptions from in-state providers or if out-of-state prescriptions transfer — especially for any specialty medications
Consider asking current doctors for a detailed transition letter summarizing each condition, current treatment plan, and any ongoing concerns
If open enrollment happens during this window, it's the perfect time to switch to a plan with strong Colorado coverage

events.title: Pack Candace's Apartment
events.description: Pack everything in Candace's apartment into boxes, wrap all furniture in padding. Leave only a temporary bed (air mattress) and a folding table to work on.
actionItems: Buy packing supplies — boxes, tape, bubble wrap, furniture pads
Sort belongings: keep, donate, trash
Pack room by room, label every box by room + contents
Wrap all furniture in moving blankets/padding
Set up air mattress and folding table as temporary living setup
Schedule donation pickup for anything not coming
events.notes: Start early and pace it — a full month gives breathing room but it goes fast. Prioritize rarely-used rooms first, leave kitchen and bedroom basics for last.
calypsySuggestions: Get a portable clothing rack instead of living out of boxes for a month — Candace will thank you
Take photos of electronics/cable setups before disconnecting so reassembly in Denver is painless
Consider a small portable WiFi desk setup (folding table + monitor stand) since Candace works remote — work comfort matters even in packing mode
Donate early and often — every box you don't move saves money and energy
Keep a 'last box' with essentials: toiletries, phone chargers, basic kitchen stuff, towels. This rides in the car, not the U-Haul

events.title: Drive U-Haul to Denver
events.description: Josh drives the U-Haul with belongings from Monrovia to Denver. Same ~16 hour route, 2 days with overnight stop.
actionItems: Reserve U-Haul — determine size needed based on combined belongings
Book midpoint hotel for overnight stop
Plan return logistics — fly back or one-way rental car?
Load U-Haul the day before (Nov 5th)
events.notes: Need to figure out how Josh gets back to Monrovia after dropping the U-Haul in Denver. Options: fly back, or have someone follow in a car.
calypsySuggestions: Book the U-Haul ASAP — November is peak moving season and availability gets tight
Consider booking a one-way flight back from Denver (DEN → LAX/BUR) in advance for the best price
The I-15 N → I-70 E route through Utah is gorgeous but watch for weather in early November — check passes before departure
Get U-Haul insurance — peace of mind for a 16-hour drive with everything you own
Load heaviest items first (furniture) and secure everything with ratchet straps, not bungees

events.title: Drive Both Cars to Denver
events.description: Josh and Candace each drive their cars from Monrovia to Denver. ~16 hours total, split over 2 days with an overnight hotel stop.
actionItems: Book midpoint hotel for overnight stop
Get both cars serviced before the drive — oil, tires, fluids
Pack car essentials: snacks, water, phone mounts, aux cables
Plan the route and share live location with each other
events.notes: Need to book hotel at midpoint (likely Las Vegas or St. George, UT area). This is the final goodbye to Monrovia!
calypsySuggestions: Make it a mini road trip — pick a fun dinner spot at the midpoint hotel city
Walkie-talkie apps (like Zello) are great for car-to-car communication without burning phone battery on calls
Each car should have a basic emergency kit: jumper cables, flashlight, first aid
Fill up before leaving — gas is cheaper in CA than along I-15 through Nevada/Utah
Consider leaving early AM (5-6 AM) to maximize daylight driving and arrive at the hotel at a reasonable hour
